intro: Chrysorhoe serrata, commonly known as the serrated chrysorhoe, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly in China and Japan. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare species in some regions.
